text: John Florence Sullivan (May 31, 1894 – March 17, 1956), known professionally as Fred Allen, was an American comedian. He was known for having his own radio show The Fred Allen Show (1932–1949). This made him one of the most popular humorists in the Golden Age of American radio.Obituary Variety, March 21, 1956. ==References== Category:1894 births Category:1956 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American radio actors Category:American radio personalities Category:American movie actors Category:Comedians from Massachusetts Category:Actors from Cambridge, Massachusetts
title: Fred Allen
